post.description:
Use this endpoint to create a pickup request for a package.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: Cannot schedule a pickup requested for a previous day.
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again.
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.name: x-customer-transaction-id
parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/pickup/v1/pickups');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_POST);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/pickup/v1/pickups"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.post(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

post.description:
Use this endpoint to check the availability of a pickup service.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.

We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

put.description:
Use this endpoint to cancel the already scheduled pickup request.
Note: A failure notification will be sent if you attempt to cancel a pickup after the FedEx courier has been dispatched to the pickup location.
Note: FedEx APIs do not support Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) mechanism.

errors.message: PREVIOUS DAY PICKUP, CANNOT CANCEL OR UPDATE
Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.
We could not authorize your credentials. Please check your permissions and try again.
The resource you requested is no longer available. Please modify your request and try again.
We encountered an unexpected error and are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.
The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

parameters.name: x-customer-transaction-id
parameters.description: This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: This is used to indicate the media type of the resource. The media type is a string sent along with the file indicating format of the file.

parameters.name: x-locale
parameters.description: This indicates the combination of language code and country code. Click here to see Locales

parameters.name: authorization
parameters.description: This indicates the authorization token for the input request.

x-code-samples.source:
<?php

$request = new HttpRequest();
$request->setUrl('https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/pickup/v1/pickups/cancel');
$request->setMethod(HTTP_METH_PUT);

$request->setHeaders(array(
  'Authorization' => 'Bearer ',
  'X-locale' => 'en_US',
  'Content-Type' => 'application/json'
));

$request->setBody(input); // 'input' refers to JSON Payload

try {
  $response = $request->send();

  echo $response->getBody();
} catch (HttpException $ex) {
  echo $ex;
}

import requests

url = "https://apis-sandbox.fedex.com/pickup/v1/pickups/cancel"

payload = input # 'input' refers to JSON Payload
headers = {
    'Content-Type': "application/json",
    'X-locale': "en_US",
    'Authorization': "Bearer "
    }

response = requests.put(url, data=payload, headers=headers)

print(response.text)

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

PudcResponseVO_CreatePickup.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

pickupConfirmationCode.description:
The confirmation number provided to the customer when a pickup is requested
Example : 3001

message.description:
Human-readable text that explains pickup notification
Example: Courier on the way

location.description:
The location from where the package will be picked up.

Note: The location will only be returned for Express Pickup.

Example: COSA

alerts.description: These are optional alerts received when a Create pickup is requested. This includes an alert code, type, and message.

CreatePickupOutputVO.description: The response elements received when you create a pickup.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: a9053a7d-6865-42ab-b323-4632db263ab4

This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: Cannot schedule a pickup requested for a previous day.

CXSError.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

value.description: Identifies the error option to be applied.

key.description: Indicates the value associated with the key.

Parameter.description: List of parameters which indicates the properties of the alert message.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: Access token expired. Please modify your request and try again.

Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: The service is currently unavailable and we are working to resolve the issue. We apologize for any inconvenience. Please check back at a later time.

CXSError503.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

originDetail.description: The origin address if different than the one associated with the shipper account. This element value is required when the package is to be picked up from an address other than the shipper account address.

associatedAccountNumberType.description:
This enumeration represents a kind of legacy account number from a FedEx operating entity for the account number associated to the pickup.
Valid values are: FEDEX_EXPRESS
FEDEX_GROUND

totalWeight.description:
Specify The total weight of the packages for the pickup. Unit of measure is
 LB.

packageCount.description:
Specify the total number of packages for the pickup.
Example: 5

carrierCode.description:
Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company that meets your requirements.
Examples of FedEx Operating Comapnies are :
  • FDXE- FedEx Express
  • FDXG- FedEx Ground

accountAddressOfRecord.description: The city name, state or province code and the address classification associated with the customer account which requested the pickup.

remarks.description:
Placeholder for any message to be passed to the FedEx pickup courier.
Note:Maximum length is 60 characters.
Example: Please ring bell at loading dock.
remarks.example: Please ring bell at loading dock.

countryRelationships.description: Describes the country relationship among the shipments being picked up. This element is not mandatory for this request, but when added, the mandatory values are DOMESTIC or INTERNATIONAL. Empty or incorrect values will result in to errors.

pickupType.description:
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment to be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Example: ON_CALL, PACKAGE_RETURN_PROGRAM, REGULAR_STOP
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.

trackingNumber.description:
This is a Tracking number for FedEx packages used for tracking a single package or group of packages.
Example: 795803657326
Click here to see mock tracking numbers for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

commodityDescription.description:
Description of the commodity being shipped.
Example:This field contains Commodity Description.
Click here to see Vague commodity descriptions

expressFreightDetail.description: Placeholder for Express Freight pickup details.

oversizePackageCount.description: Specify the number of oversize packages that are tendered to FedEx Ground.

Full_Schema_Create_Pickup.description: Use this endpoint to create a pickup request.

PickupChargesPayment.description: Specifies how the pickup charges will be paid.

paymentType.description: Type of payment for the pickup charges.

Payor.description: Details about the party responsible for payment.

responsibleParty.description: The entity paying for the pickup charges.

accountNumber.description: The FedEx account number of the responsible party.

value.description:
Conditional.
The account number value. Max Length is 9.

key.description: The account key associated with this account number.

PayorType.description: Identifies the role of the party paying for the pickup.

value.description:
This is the account number. Maximum Length is 9.
Example: Your account number

AccountNumber.description:
This is the FedEx account number.
Example: Your account number

OriginDetail.description: This is the origin address, if different than the one associated with the shipper account. It is required if the package is to be picked up from an address other than the shipper account address.

pickupAddressType.description:
Indicates the type of pickup address being used whether it is account address, shipper address or alternate address.
Note:
The default value is OTHER.

readyDateTimestamp.description:
Indicates the date and time when the freight shipment/package is ready for pick up.
Note:
1.The date format must be YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.
2.The time must be in the format: HH:MM:SS using a 24-hour clock.
3.The date and time are separated by the letter T, such as 2015-03-25T09:30:00.
4.The time is local to the pickup postal code.5.Do not include a TZD (time zone designator) as it will be ignored.
Example: 2019-11-15T11:00:00

customerCloseTime.description:
Indicates the latest local time at which the driver can gain access to pickup the package(s).Format HH:MM:SS.
Note:
1.The time must be in the format: HH:MM:SS using a 24-hour clock.
2.The time is local to the pickup postal code.
3.Do not include a TZD (time zone designator) as it will be ignored.
Example: 2019-11-15T11:00:00

pickupDateType.description: Indicates whether the pickup request is for the same day or on a future date.

packageLocation.description:
This provides a location description from where the courier/driver must pick up the package. It is mandatory for Ground Pickup.
Example: FRONT

buildingPartDescription.description:
Indicates the building part such as floor suite or apartment number or an identifier of the building.
Example: 111

earlyPickup.description: Indicates if it is an early pickup. This applies only to Europe.

suppliesRequested.description:
Indicates if any shipping supplies are requested at the pickup origin required to pack the shipment such as FedEx Box, Large Box, FedEx Tube.
Example: Supplies requested by customer

geographicalPostalCode.description: This is the alternate postal code associated with pickup location. (Applicable only for European pickups)

PickupLocationParty.description: The descriptive data for the party responsible for the pickup and the physical location from which the shipment is picked up.

deliveryInstructions.description: Indicates the detailed instructions for delivery.This is used with Ground Home Delivery.

Party_createPickup.description: Indicates attributes for a Party to perform a transaction including the physical address, contact information and account number information.

companyName.description: Specify the contact person's company name. Maximum length is 35.

personName.description: Specify the contact person's name. Maximum Length is 70.

phoneNumber.description: Specify the contact person's phone number. Minimum Length is 8 and Maximum legth is 13.

phoneExtension.description: Specify the contact person's phone extension. Maximum length is 6.

Contact_CreatePickup.description: Indicates the contact details for the party such as name, phonenumber.

streetLines.description:
This is a combination of number, street name, etc.
Note: At least one line is required and streetlines more than 3 will be ignored. Empty lines should not be included.
Example: [\"10 FedEx Parkway\", \"Suite 302\"]

urbanizationCode.description:
Optional
In Puerto Rico, identical street names and address number ranges can be found within the same ZIP Code. In these cases, the urbanization name is the only element that correctly identifies the location of a particular address.
Example: URB FAIR OAKS

city.description:
This is a placeholder for City Name.
Note: This is conditional and not required in all the shipping requests.
Example: Beverly Hills

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is a placeholder for State or Province code.Maximum length is 2. Maximum length is 2
Example: CA
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
This is a placeholder for postal code.
Note: The postal code is required for postal-aware countries.
Example: 38127
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
This is the two-letter country code.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description: Indicate whether this address is Residential as opposed to Commercial.

addressClassification.description: Classifies a given address as either of unknown, residential, mixed or business.

Address.description: Descriptive data for a physical location. May be used as an actual physical address (place to which one could go), or as a container of "address parts" which should be handled as a unit (such as a city-state-ZIP combination within the US).

units.description: Indicates the type of package weight.

value.description:
Indicates the package weight. Maximum length is 99999.
Example: 20

Weight.description: These are the package weight details.

streetLines.description:
Specify Street line details for the given address
Example :[\"10 FedEx Parkway\", \"Suite 302\"]

city.description:
Conditional
The name of city, town, etc.
Example: Memphis

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
This is state or province code. Maximum length is 2.
Example: ON
Click here to see State/Province Code

postalCode.description:
Specify the postal code. This is optional for non postal-aware countries. Maximum length is 10.
Example: 38017
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
The two-letter code used to identify a country. Maximum length is 2.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

residential.description: Indicates whether this address is residential (as opposed to commercial).

addressClassification.description: Classifies a given address as either of unknown, residential, mixed or business.

Address_1.description: Conditionally required. For the Address, street, city and country are required if PickupAddressType is set to SHIPPER or OTHER.

service.description:
Specify FedEx Service for the shipment.
Example: FEDEX_1_DAY_FREIGHT

trailerLength.description: Specify the trailer size, required for dispatch.

bookingNumber.description:
Express Freight shipments (refer below) may require booking number. This booking number may also be required for freight dispatch requests.
FedEx 1Day Freight - booking number is optional.
FedEx International Priority Freight - booking number is required
NOTE:
a. For Intra EU (EU-to-EU) and EU outbound (EU-to-NON_EU) Express Freight shipments, bookingNumber is optional.
b. For Express Freight shipments not originating in EU, Customers need to call FedEx to book freight shipment and receive a booking number. This booking number is included in the Ship request and prints on the shipping label.
example:1234AGTT

dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

ExpressFreightPickupDetail.description: Provides the Express Freight pickup detailed information.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value is 999.
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value is 999.
Example: 15

units.description: Specify the unit of measurement used for the package dimensions.

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value: 999
Example: 12

Dimensions.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

PickupNotificationdetail.description: This object allows user to request for pickup confirmation email. User can specify upto 5 email addresses.

emailDetails.description: Specify the list of email addresses along with locale to which the pickup confirmation email should be sent.

userMessage.description:
Specifies the user message that can be sent as part of the pickup confirmation email.
Example: This is the user message

locale.description:
Specify the language in which the email needs to be sent.Default value is en_US.
Example: en_US. .
Click here to see Locales

EmailDetail.description: Email addresses along with locale to which the pickup confirmation email must be sent.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

PudcResponseVO_PickupAvailability.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

requestTimestamp.description:
The time when the PickupAvailability request was processed.
Note:
1.The date format must be YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.
2.The time must be in the format: HH:MM:SS using a 24-hour clock.
3.The date and time are separated by the letter T, such as 2015-03-25T09:30:00.
4.The time is local to the pickup postal code
5.Do not include a TZD (time zone designator) as it will be ignored.
Example: 2019-11-15T11:00:00

options.description: The pickup schedule details, such as the carrier, latest available time of pickup, default latest available time, availability for pickup, time when the package is ready to be picked up, indication if the address is residential, cutoff time of the pickup, and driver's access to pick up the package.

alerts.description: Any optional alert messages received when a pickup availability is requested. This includes an alert code, type, and message.

carrier.description: Specifies the FedEx transportation carrier for the pickup option.

available.description: Indicates the availability of pickup option.If the value is true, it indicates the pickup option is available. If the value is false, it indicates pickup option is not available.

pickupDate.description:
Indicates the date (in the pickup postal code's time zone)which refers to the pickup schedule option.
Format: YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2019-01-20

cutOffTime.description:
Specifies the latest allowed ready time for the pickup option. The time is local to the pickup postal code.
Format: HH:MM:SS
Example: 18:30:00

residentialAvailable.description: Indicates whether residential pickup is available for the requested postal code.

countryRelationship.description:
Describes the country relationship among the shipments.DOMESTIC indicates intra-country shipping and cut off times.
INTERNATIONAL indicates inter-country shipping and cut off times.
Cut off times may vary for DOMESTIC and INTERNATIONAL.

scheduleDay.description: Indicates scheduled pickup day of the week.

defaultReadyTime.description:
The default ready time for the shipment to be picked up. FedEx will assume the shipment is ready for pickup at this time unless otherwise indicated on the 'CreatePickup' Request. Format:HH:MM:SS
Example: 14:00:00

defaultLatestTimeOptions.description:
The default latest time for the shipment to be picked up.
Format:HH:MM:SS
Example: 19:00:00

earlyCutOffTime.description:
Identifies the early cut-off time for the pickup option. The time is local to the pickup postal code. It includes a TZD (time zone designator) for FedEx Freight requests.
Format: HH:MM:SS
Example: 18:30:00

earlyPickupLocationId.description:
The location from where the package will be picked up
Example: PITA

readyTimeOptions.description:
The ReadyTimeOptions indicates the possible ready time windows for the shipment to be picked up.FedEx will assume the shipment is ready for pickup at this time
Example: 11:00:00, 11:30:00
Note:Based on the cutOffTimes provided readyTimeOptions are returned.

latestTimeOptions.description:
The LatestTimeOptions indicates the possible latest time windows for the shipment to be picked up.FedEx will assume the shipment is ready for pickup at this time
Example: 12:00:00,12:30:00,13:00:00,13:30:00....23:59:00
Note:LatestTimeOptions are return till endoftheday timings.

hours.description:
This is the minimum time window in hours that is allocated for the FedEx courier to make the pickup.
Example: 'PT1H0M' means Pickup Time is 1 Hour and 0 Minutes

minutes.description:
This is the minimum time window in minutes that is allocated for the FedEx courier to make the pickup.
Example: 'PT1H0M' means Pickup Time is 1 Hour and 0 Minutes

Duration.description:
This is the minimum required time window between the shipment ReadyTime and the customer close time (or the local 'cutoff time' if it is earlier than the customer close time).
Example: hours: 1 minutes: 30

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 6f821609-aeb6-4ffe-b783-6e60b20f2801

customerTransactionId.description:
"This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and help you match the request to the reply
Example : AnyCo_order123456789"

message.description:
Indicates the description of API error alert message.
Example: PostalCode is missing.

CXSError_2.description: Indicates error alert when suspicious files, potential exploits and viruses found while scanning files , directories and user accounts. This includes code, message and parameter

dispatchDate.description:
Specify the date the package is to be picked up. The format is YYYY-MM-DD. If left blank, the system considers current date as dispatch date.
Example: 2020-01-01

packageReadyTime.description:
Specify the time that the package will be ready for pickup. The time format is HH:MM:SS and it refers to the local timezone. The driver should pick up the package/shipment by the given pickup time.
Example: 15:00:00

customerCloseTime.description:
Specify the latest time the driver gets access to pick up the package. The time format is in HH:MM:SS and it refers to the local timezone. The driver should pick up the package by the given pickup time.
Example: 18:00:00

pickupType.description:
Indicate the pickup type method by which the shipment to be tendered to FedEx.
Note: The value of this element does not specify dispatching the courier for package pickup.
Click here for more information on Pickup Types.

numberOfBusinessDays.description:
Specify number of business days to consider when checking availability.
For example if you are indicating pickupDate for a Saturday and you indicate 3, Saturday, Sunday and Monday will be considered.
Example: 3

packageDetails.description: This object is used to specify the package details.

associatedAccountNumber.description:
The associated account number, which will be invoiced for the pickup.
Example:613787364.

associatedAccountNumberType.description:
This represents a kind of legacy account number from a FedEx operating entity for the account number associated to the pickup.
Valid values are: FEDEX_EXPRESS
FEDEX_GROUND

carriers.description:
Specify the four letter code of a FedEx operating company thet meets your requirements.
Examples of FedEx Operating Companies are:
  • FDXE - FedEx Express
  • FDXG - FedEx Ground

countryRelationship.description:
Specify the country relationship among the shipments being picked up. Empty or incorrect values will result in to errors.

Note: shipmentAttributes/serviceType is required for domestic or international pickup availabilities.

Full_Schema_Pickup_Availability.description: These are pickup availability request elements.

PickupAddress.description: Specify the address for which pickup availability inquiry has been made.

postalCode.description:
This is the Postal code for the Pickup address.
Example: 38017
Click here to see Postal aware countries

countryCode.description:
This is the country code for the Pickup address.
Example: US
Click here to see Country Codes

ShipmentAttributes.description:
Specify the shipment details, such as service type, packaging type, weight and dimensions.

Note: serviceType is required for domestic or international pickup availabilities.

serviceType.description:
Specify the FedEx service type for the shipment.
Example: FEDEX_FREIGHT_PRIORITY

packagingType.description: Specify the FedEx Packaging Type for the shipment.

PickupShipmentAttributes.description: Indicates the optional attributes for the shipment related to the pickup inquiry.

length.description:
Indicate the length of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value is 999.
Example: 20

width.description:
Indicate the width of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value is 999.
Example: 10

height.description:
Indicate the height of the package. No implied decimal places. Maximum value is 999.
Example: 10

units.description:
Unit of measure for the provided dimensions.
Note: Any value other than CM including blank/null will default to IN.

Dimensions_2.description:
Indicate the dimensions of the package.
Following conditions will apply:
  • Dimensions are optional but when added, then all three dimensions must be indicated.
  • Dimensions are required with YOUR_PACKAGING package type.
Note: The maximum/minimum dimension values varies based on the services and the packaging types. Refer FedEx Service Guide for service details related to DIM Weighting for FedEx Express and oversize conditions for FedEx Express and FedEx Ground.

specialServiceTypes.description:
Specifies special service types.
Example: DANGEROUS_GOODS
Click here to see Package level Special Service Types

PackageSpecialServices.description: Indicates the special services associated with this package.

transactionId.description:
The transaction ID is a special set of numbers that defines each transaction.
Example: 624deea6-b709-470c-8c39-4b5511281492

customerTransactionId.description:
This element allows you to assign a unique identifier to your transaction. This element is also returned in the reply and helps you match the request to the reply.
Example: AnyCo_order123456789

PudcResponseVO_CancelPickup.description: This is a wrapper class for outputVO

pickupConfirmationCode.description:
Specify the pickup confirmation code.
Example: NQAA97

cancelConfirmationMessage.description:
Indicates a cancelled pickup confirmation message.
Example: Requested pickup has been cancelled successfully.
cancelConfirmationMessage.example: Requested pickup has been cancelled Successfully.

alerts.description: Optional alerts received when a cancel pickup is requested. This includes an alert code, type, and message.

pickupConfirmationCode.description:
The confirmation number provided by FedEx to the customer when the pickup was scheduled or requested.
Example: 7

remarks.description:
Placeholder for any message to be passed to the FedEx pickup courier.
Note:Maximum length is 60 characters.
Example: Please ring bell at loading dock.
remarks.example: Please ring bell at loading dock.

carrierCode.description:
This is a placeholder to provide the FedEx operating company (transportation) code used for package delivery. Required for FedEx Ground.
Optional for FedEx Express.
The Default is FedEx Express i.e. FDXE.

scheduledDate.description:
Indicates the date the pickup dispatch occurs.
Format YYYY-MM-DD
Example: 2019-10-15

location.description: The FedEx Express location identifier responsible for processing the pickup request. This is returned in the CreatePickup response and is required to cancel a FedEx Express dispatch.Required only for FedEx Express Pickups. Optional for FedEx Ground. Example: LOSA

Full_Schema_Cancel_Pickup.description: This is a placeholder for cancelled pickup request elements.

AccountAddressOfRecord.description: Address details for the associated pickup account. Indicates if the address is residential. Specifies the city name, country code, streetline number, postal code, address verification Identifier, and state or province code.

city.description:
Placeholder for the pickup city. Max length is 35.
Example: Memphis

stateOrProvinceCode.description:
The two character state/proviceCode for the pickup. Max length is 2.
Example: ON
Click here to see State/Province Code
